p: Impulse control behaviours (ICB) in PD are an important complication of dopaminergic replacement therapy (particularly dopamine agonists). It is not currently clear whether certain ethnicities are more prone to ICBs, but there may be differences in the most common impulsive behaviours in different regions that could be culturally driven as demonstrated in Table 3 [ 96–116]. Some of the ICBs that are reported in the literature seem to be exclusive to particular cultures, for example, Otmani et al., report an “ICB mimic” that had not been reported in the literature before; excessive Qur’an reading [ 103].
